Package org.apache.zookeeper.server.backup

Class SpotRestorationTool

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.zookeeper.server.backup.SpotRestorationTool
  • public class SpotRestorationTool
extends java.lang.Object
    This is a tool for automatic zk path-based restoration of ZK data based on a zk node path using a collection of snapshot and transaction logs.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      SpotRestorationTool​(java.io.File dataDir, ZooKeeper zk, java.lang.String targetZNodePath, boolean restoreRecursively)
      Constructor

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      protected boolean getUserConfirmation​(java.lang.String requestMsg, java.lang.String yesMsg, java.lang.String noMsg)  
      void run()
      Run the spot restoration.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • SpotRestorationTool

        public SpotRestorationTool​(java.io.File dataDir,
                           ZooKeeper zk,
                           java.lang.String targetZNodePath,
                           boolean restoreRecursively)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Constructor
        Parameters:
        dataDir - The directory contains fully-restored snapshot and transaction log files to be used for spot restoration
        zk - A client connection to the zk server to be restored
        targetZNodePath - The znode path to restore
        restoreRecursively - If true then restore the whole sub-data tree of the target znode; if false then restore the target znode only
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
         throws java.io.IOException,
                java.lang.InterruptedException
        Run the spot restoration. 1. If a node exists in restored data tree but not in the zk server, create the node in the server 2. If a node exists in zk server but not the restored data tree, show messages that inform user to manually delete the node after this spot restoration run 3. If a node exists in both zk server and restored data tree, show message that inform user to manually delete the node after this spot restoration run and run spot restoration on the node path again
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • getUserConfirmation

        protected boolean getUserConfirmation​(java.lang.String requestMsg,

                                      java.lang.String noMsg)
                               throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException
